pullRequests.title: sets cursor rules for console repository
pullRequests.body: # üìù Summary **Ticket Summary (Title):** ## Enhanced Cursor Rules for ACM Console Development This PR introduces comprehensive Cursor AI rules tailored specifically for the ACM (Advanced Cluster Management) console codebase. These rules provide intelligent, context-aware guidance to accelerate development while maintaining code quality and consistency. ### Key Benefits **Faster Onboarding** - New developers get instant guidance on ACM-specific patterns, component usage, and architectural decisions - Reduces learning curve with real examples from the actual codebase **Enhanced Development Speed** - AI suggestions follow established ACM patterns (Recoil state management, PatternFly components, plugin architecture) - Prevents common mistakes with ESLint-enforced patterns (acm-i18next, shared-recoil imports) **Code Quality & Consistency** - Enforces ACM-specific standards: HTTP/2 backend patterns, accessibility testing with jest-axe, proper RBAC implementations - Ensures consistent import organization, form patterns (AcmDataForm/SyncEditor), and plugin communication **Domain-Specific Intelligence** - Backend: HTTP/2 routing, server-side events, Kubernetes API proxying patterns - Frontend: React 18 + Recoil + PatternFly component patterns - Testing: Mandatory accessibility tests, proper mocking strategies - Plugins: ACM/MCE plugin communication and shared context patterns ### What's Included - **10 specialized rule files** covering backend, frontend, testing, plugins, security, and more - **Real code examples** extracted from the actual codebase - **ESLint integration** with project-specific rule enforcement - **Architecture guidance** for forms, wizards, state management, and plugin development These rules transform Cursor from a generic AI assistant into an ACM console development expert, providing contextually relevant suggestions that align with our established patterns and best practices. **Ticket Link:** **Type of Change:** - [ ] üêû Bug Fix - [ ] ‚ú® Feature - [ ] üîß Refactor - [ ] üí∏ Tech Debt - [ ] üß™ Test-related - [ ] üìÑ Docs --- ## ‚úÖ Checklist ### General - [ ] PR title follows the convention (e.g. `ACM-12340 Fix bug with...`) - This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|
| [node](https://nodejs.org) ([source](https://redirect.github.com/nodejs/node)) | patch | `20.19.4` -> `20.19.5` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>nodejs/node (node)</summary>

### [`v20.19.5`](https://redirect.github.com/nodejs/node/releases/tag/v20.19.5): 2025-09-03, Version 20.19.5 'Iron' (LTS), @​marco-ippolito

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/nodejs/node/compare/v20.19.4...v20.19.5)

##### Notable Changes

- \[[`f5b293ad48`](https://redirect.github.com/nodejs/node/commit/f5b293ad48)] - **doc**: add JonasBa to collaborators (Jonas Badalic) [#​58355](https://redirect.github.com/nodejs/node/pull/58355)
- \[[`4e6ae787c6`](https://redirect.github.com/nodejs/node/commit/4e6ae787c6)] - **doc**: add puskin to collaborators (Giovanni Bucci) [#​58308](https://redirect.github.com/nodejs/node/pull/58308)
- \[[`d06db658fc`](https://redirect.github.com/nodejs/node/commit/d06db658fc)] - **doc**: add Filip Skokan to TSC (Rafael Gonzaga) [#​58499](https://redirect.github.com/nodejs/node/pull/58499)
- \[[`3c6206cac9`](https://redirect.github.com/nodejs/node/commit/3c6206cac9)] - **doc**: add [@​geeksilva97](https://redirect.github.com/geeksilva97) to collaborators (Edy Silva) [#​57241](https://redirect.github.com/nodejs/node/pull/57241)

##### Commits

pullRequests.title: ACM-23853 Fix app topology resource details table search box
pullRequests.body:
# üìù Summary

**Ticket Summary (Title):**  
Application topology details table search is broken

**Ticket Link:**  
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/ACM-23853

**Type of Change:**  
<!-- Select one -->
- [X] üêû Bug Fix  
- [ ] ‚ú® Feature  
- [ ] üîß Refactor
- [ ] üí∏ Tech Debt
- [ ] üß™ Test-related  
- [ ] üìÑ Docs

---

## ‚úÖ Checklist

### General

- [X] PR title follows the convention (e.g. `ACM-12340 Fix bug with...`)
- [X] Code builds and runs locally without errors
- [X] No console logs, commented-out code, or unnecessary files
- [X] All commits are meaningful and well-labeled
- [X] All new display strings are externalized for localization (English only)
- [X] *(Nice to have)* JSDoc comments added for new functions and interfaces

#### If Bugfix

- [ ] Root cause and fix summary are documented in the ticket (for future reference / errata)
- [X] Fix tested thoroughly and resolves the issue
- [ ] Test(s) added to prevent regression

---

### üóíÔ∏è Notes for Reviewers
This was probably introduced when we upgraded to PF5 or perhaps even slightly before, as some event handler prototypes were change in later releases of PF4.

pullRequests.title: ACM-23618 Adds resource route extensions ACM first class resource pages
pullRequests.body:
# üìù Summary

**Ticket Summary (Title):**  
<!-- Use the exact title from Jira or a brief, clear summary -->
Summary
Register `acm.resource/route` extensions for ACM first-class resources to enable proper routing when using `@stolostron/multicluster-sdk` `FleetResourceLink` components.
Details

1. Removes the special handling for ManagedCluster in the FleetResourceLink
2. Add resource route extensions for all resources currently defined in searchDefinitions.tsx that link to ACM pages instead of generic search details (`ManagedCluster, Policy, Application - K8s, Application - Argo and PolicyReport`)
3. Use kubevirt-plugin implementation as reference pattern from here https://github.com/kubevirt-ui/kubevirt-plugin/pull/2923
4. Create separate extension for each resource kind with shared handler implementation
5. No changes to existing search implementation

**Ticket Link:**  
<!-- e.g. https://issues.redhat.com/browse/ACM-12345 -->
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/ACM-23618

- [ ] üîß Refactor
- [ ] üí∏ Tech Debt

- [ ] üìÑ Docs

pullRequests.title: ACM-23508 ACM-23527 ACM-23498 ACM-23512 remove frontend crypto usage
pullRequests.body:
# üìù Summary

**Ticket Summary (Title):**  
Removes usage of crypto via crypto-browserify in the console frontend to address CVE-2025-9287 and CVE-2025-9288. Dependencies on cipher-base and sha.js are removed.

**Ticket Link:**  
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/ACM-23508
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/ACM-23527
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/ACM-23498
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/ACM-23512

**Type of Change:**  
<!-- Select one -->
- [ ] üêû Bug Fix  
- [ ] ‚ú® Feature  
- [ ] üîß Refactor
- [X] üí∏ Tech Debt
- [ ] üß™ Test-related  
- [ ] üìÑ Docs

---

## ‚úÖ Checklist

### General

- [X] PR title follows the convention (e.g. `ACM-12340 Fix bug with...`)
- [X] Code builds and runs locally without errors
- [X] No console logs, commented-out code, or unnecessary files
- [X] All commits are meaningful and well-labeled
- [X] All new display strings are externalized for localization (English only)
- [X] *(Nice to have)* JSDoc comments added for new functions and interfaces

pullRequests.title: rename js files that use that use jsx to jsx and fixed some imports
pullRequests.body:
Refactor: Renamed React component files to .jsx extension

This PR renames several component files from a .js to a .jsx extension. This change is a simple refactoring and does not introduce any functional changes.

Why this change?

The .jsx extension is the widely accepted convention for files that contain JSX syntax. By adopting this convention, we improve code clarity and make it easier for developers (and tools) to immediately recognize which files are React components.

This is a minor but meaningful change that helps align our codebase with best practices in the React ecosystem.

pullRequests.title: ACM-22793: Adding backend path for hypershift status, addon, and multiClusterEngine access
pullRequests.body:
# üìù Summary

**Ticket Summary (Title):**  
<!-- Use the exact title from Jira or a brief, clear summary -->

When the UI determines if the hosted control plane feature is enabled for displaying the hosted control plane creation wizard, it requires the user to have access to the following resources.

MultiClusterEngine CR
ManagedClusterAddOn CRs
 
If the user does not have access to these resources, the UI displays this even though the hosted control plane features are enabled in MCE.

We used the backend's service account on behalf of the user to check these required resources so that we can avoid having to give the non-admin user explicit access to MCE resources.

**Ticket Link:**  
<!-- e.g. https://issues.redhat.com/browse/ACM-12345 -->

pullRequests.title: ACM-21337 FleetResourceLink updates
pullRequests.body:
# üìù Summary

**Ticket Summary (Title):**  
<!-- Use the exact title from Jira or a brief, clear summary -->
Implement FleetResourceLink with Extension-Based Routing
This PR implements a smart resource linking system that automatically routes users to the best page based on their context using the OpenShift Dynamic Plugin SDK's extension system.

Key Changes

## FleetResourceLink Implementation
Smart resource linking for ACM multi-cluster environments with extension-based routing

1. No location-based behavior - Route decisions based only on resource type and cluster context 
2. ACM native resources get direct links - ManagedCluster always routes to /multicloud/infrastructure/clusters/details/ 
3. Extension system for plugin routes - Uses useResolvedExtensions for VirtualMachine and other plugin-provided routes 
4. Smart fallbacks - Hub clusters fallback to the OpenShift console, managed clusters to ACM search 
5. Text loading states - Shows resource name instead of skeleton when hub loading 
6. Extension lookup pattern - Exact version match first, then version-agnostic fallback
7. Direct SDK access - SDK components use useResolvedExtensions directly per architecture guidelines 


## Extension System

1. New extension type - acm.resource/route for custom resource routing
2. Handler interface - Functions receive cluster, namespace, name, resource, model parameters
3. Shared utilities - Reusable extension lookup and path generation functions

## Intelligent resource linking that adapts to ACM's multi-cluster environment while maintaining consistency with OpenShift console patterns.

**Ticket Link:**  
<!-- e.g. https://issues.redhat.com/browse/ACM-12345 -->
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/ACM-21337

**Type of Change:**  
<!-- Select one -->
- [ ] üêû Bug Fix  
- [X] ‚ú® Feature  
- [ ] üîß Refactor
- [ ] üí∏ Tech Debt
- [ ] üß™ Test-related  
- [ ] üìÑ Docs

---

## ‚úÖ Checklist

pullRequests.title: ACM-21111: Truncate, highlightSearchText
pullRequests.body:
# üìù Summary **Ticket Summary (Title):** [ACM-21111](https://issues.redhat.com/browse/ACM-21111) (AcmTable truncate should be responsive to column size) Also regarding: [ACM-22427](https://issues.redhat.com/browse/ACM-22427) (AcmTable HighlightSearchText can truncate text too many times.) **Ticket Link:** **Type of Change:** - [x] üêû Bug Fix - [x] ‚ú® Feature - [ ] üîß Refactor - [ ] üí∏ Tech Debt - [ ] üß™ Test-related - [ ] üìÑ Docs --- ## ‚úÖ Checklist ### General - [x] PR title follows the convention (e.g. `ACM-12340 Fix bug with...`) - [x] Code builds and runs locally without errors - [x] No console logs, commented-out code, or unnecessary files - [x] All commits are meaningful and well-labeled - [ ] All new display strings are externalized for localization (English only) - [ ] *(Nice to have)* JSDoc comments added for new functions and interfaces #### If Feature - [ ] UI/UX reviewed (if applicable) - [ ] All acceptance criteria met - [ ] Unit test coverage added or updated - [ ] Relevant documentation or comments included #### If Bugfix - [ ] Root cause and fix summary are documented in the ticket (for future reference / errata) - [ ] Fix tested thoroughly and resolves the issue - [ ] Test(s) added to prevent regression --- ### üóíÔ∏è **Notes for Reviewers** * **To test,** use the table search toolbar where HighlightSearchText is active (Managed Clusters, Applications) * Note that when truncation occurs, you should be able to wave over the truncated text to render a popover with the full text. * Highlighting also appears in the popover. **Questions to reviewers:** 1. Does blue text on a black popover create an accessibility violation. It can be a bit hard to read at times.

2. I've added a condition within the renderCell method of the AcmTable that will hand off string/number type cells into our HighlightSearchText component by default, however there are still cases in which the cell passed to the table is a reactNode/object, and if we want all the objects that could be transitioned to use this component to be migrated, I think it might be best to take that on in a separate PR. You will notice certain cells (**Links/buttons mostly**) that do not already include the HighlightSearchText component in their template will not share the behavior of those targeted by this PR. This is expected.

pullRequests.title: ACM-22587 OCP console unresponsive after opening ACM console Argo app
pullRequests.body:
application details uses the uidata api to get list of clusters an app has been deployed to
the api was being called with the name of the app, but it was also passing all of the details of its cluster
those details were unneeded and occasionally caused json syntax errors on the backend causing the get to fail

Signed-off-by: John Swanke <jswanke@redhat.com>

application details uses the uidata api to get list of clusters an app has been deployed to
the api was being called with the name of the app, but it was also passing all of the details of its cluster
those details were unneeded and occasionally caused json syntax errors on the backend causing the get to fail
